fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a page contains a Page Layout and a Table at the bottom of a long page. Table selecting will fail and browser scrolls to the top of the page.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-16cbad1
Chrome Version 60.0.3112.113
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with two-page layout
 # On the lower page layout, create a content that will not fit on one screen
 # Insert a table at the end of the page layout.

h3. Expected Results
 * Table selecting should work properly

h3. Actual Results
 * Table selecting is not working properly. Browser scrolls to the top of the page.

 

Workaround
 * Use another browser like Firefox
fields.summary: Table selecting fails in Chrome browser

fields.description:
The new UI experience limits the ability to quick navigate through pages several nesting deep. We need to be able to go from the "Overview" page to a page 4 layers deep quickly and easily. The page tree is vital to our usage of Confluence. We tried using the new UI for a week and it has made switching between pages and spaces much more difficult.

It is very disorienting in the new look to get back to the home page or navigate between topics when you are several pages in. This means a lot of clicking back to home/pages, then clicking back through sub-pages. This takes much more time and is harder to explain to people then the previous functionality.
h2. *{color:#FF0000}We would need the ability to turn{color} the{color:#FF0000} page tree back on and use markup in the configure sidebar back!{color}*
fields.summary: Page Tree in Sidebar!!!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After installign *LaTeX Math* add-on on a Confluence instance, if you attempt to insert one of LaTeX macros on a page using Safari for the first time will return an error message on the appearing pop-up:
{code}There is no metadata configured for this macro which means no configuration screen can be presented here.{code} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *LaTeX Math* on your Cloud instance.
# Using Safari, attempts to insert a macros from the *LaTeX Math* add-on.

h3. Expected Results
A pop-up opens and displays the macro settings properly.

h3. Actual Results
A pop-up opens and displays the following error message:
{code}There is no metadata configured for this macro which means no configuration screen can be presented here.{code}
 
h3. Notes
This is only reproducible on the 1st use of *LaTeX Math* with Safari. If it was already used before then it will not be reproducible.

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser and try to insert a *LaTeX Math* macro on it. The pop-up will display properly allowing you to use it on Safari as well.
fields.summary: On 1st use of LaTeX Math with Safari, inserting a new LaTeX macro returns a metadata error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Numbering column becomes editable once the page published. Since all the row of numbering column will be automatically reset and ordered when user adds/deletes table's row, the numbering column should not be editable.

!Screenshot_2017-08-29_15_04_06.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Make numbering column non-editable.
h3. Notes

Confluence editor behaves inconsistently between Safari and Chrome. Currently numbering column is editable only if selected as heading column in Safari.
|| ||Unpuplished||Published||Published & heading column||
|Chrome|(/) Not editable|(x) Editable|(x) Editable|
|Safari|(/) Not editable|(/) Not editable|(x) Editable|

Verified with:
 * Safari version 10.1.2 (12603.3.8)
 * Chrome version 60.0.3112.101 (Official Build) (64-bit)
fields.summary: Numbering column should not be editable

fields.description:
Trying to disable captcha:
 * Admin -> Security Settings
 * Deselect the "Captcha on login" option

After saving the page, you'll notice the captcha option is still selected.
fields.summary: Cannot disable Captcha

fields.description:
When creating new Questions in specific spaces, it will not provide an option to move it and the workaround would be to manually create a question with the same title/answer, which will require some manual work in order to have it implemented. 

This is a suggestion to have a bundled option to move the Question for a new space.
fields.summary: Option to Move Confluence Questions Between Spaces

fields.description:
Previously, for older Confluence versions, when installing Questions, the user would have an option to use the [Questions List Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questions/integrate-questions-with-your-spaces-407724495.html]. However, this macro is not included on the add-on anymore. 

This is a suggestion to implement this macro back, so the users can display the content of Questions in a page.
fields.summary: Questions List for Confluence Cloud
Importing an existing Atlassian Account user with different username fails import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Customers do not have an automatic way to import spaces on Confluence

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a tool/API where customers are able perform bulk Space Import.
fields.summary: Import Spaces through API

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk project in JIRA
# Create a knowledge base in the service desk project
# Go to the KB in Confluence and create a JIRA issue macro in the KB to retrieve JIRA issue
# As portal only customer, view the KB. There will be error message “issue doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it." on the JIRA issue macro. However, when clicking the issue key, the customer can actually see the issue in customer portal

h3. Suggestion
To hide the error message "issue doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it." as it is very misleading to the portal customer
fields.summary: To hide the error message “issue doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it." for portal customer when viewing JIRA issue macro in KB in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Breadcrumbs on spaces with custom homepages leads to 'Page Not Found'

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Space on Confluence
# Create a new Page (A) on that space
# Set this page as the homepage for this space
# Move all child pages from the old homepage (B) to the new one (A)
# Delete the old homepage (B)
# Access any page with breadcrumbs linking to the space home
# Click the breadcrumb 

h3. Expected Results
You should be redirected to the current space homepage

h3. Actual Results
You are redirected to a 'Page Not Found' page, and if you look to the URL it is still pointing to the old homepage.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs on spaces with custom homepages leads to 'Page Not Found'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Confluence new look the quick search on the global sidebar shows a limited number of results per categories (Pages, Attachments, Spaces, etc). This limits the usability of the quick search.
h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option in the user profile to configure the minimum number of search results returned in the quick search, making it configurable on a user basis.
And make the quick search results scrollable on the global sidebar just like the settings menu is.
h3. Why this is important
This will increase user's productivity as they'll have faster access to the pages in the quick search.
fields.summary: Ability for the user to configure minimum search results on quick search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pages containing JIRA Issue Macros are displayed as blank pages and then return a _Page not found_ error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to open a page containing JIRA Issue Macros.

h3. Expected Results
The page is displayed properly.

h3. Actual Results
The page first appears as blank and then displays a _Page not found_ error message.
 
h3.Workaround
Contact Atlassian Cloud Support so they can fix this from our end.
fields.summary: Pages containing JIRA Issue Macros are rendered blank

fields.description:
As a Confluence Admin I would like to have an ability to deny a permission from a user or a group.

I have a space that is confidential and should be viewed by all Confluence users expect for one specific user.

The user should be able to view/edit in all other spaces as usual like any other Confluence user, except that confidential space that is allowed for everybody except him.

Currently there is no easy way to do it.
fields.summary: Add ability in to deny a permission from a user or a group for specific space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User are not redirected to confluence home from *Activity* and *Your work*.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Go to https://yourcloudurl/wiki/my/recent-work or https://yourcloudurl/wiki/discover/all-updates
# Click on Confluence Home image
!upload.jpg|thumbnail!



h3. Observed Behaviour

The page will refresh.


h3. Expected behaviour

The user will be redirected to confluence home page.
fields.summary: Unable to navigate to confluence Home

fields.description:
I've started to see a "Page moved" flag when entering the editor, when I shouldn't.

The flag should only show when the page has been moved by someone else _while I'm in the editor._
fields.summary: Erroneous "page moved" message when entering the editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new SPA layout will ignore all Header and Footer customisation on *overview* pages in {{Confluence Admin >> Sidebar, Header and Footer}}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Navigate to {{Confluence Admin >> Sidebar, Header and Footer}}, and set the Header to "test"
 # You should be able to see "test" on top of all your pages (including overview page) in Confluence
 # Check overview pages of any space

h3. Expected results

The customization to the header should still be visible on all pages including overview page
h3. Actual results

The customisation disappears on overview pages only.

 

 

Confluence 1000.0.0-94d6404
fields.summary: New Confluence experience does not show Header and Footer Customizations on overview page

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user can use the Product Requirements template in order to include content such as tickets within a JIRA sprint (summary, priority, ticket link). 

This is a suggestion to automate the process in order to have tickets automatically added to the table in the product requirements page in Confluence when adding a Jira sprint.
fields.summary: Option to Automatically Add Tickets to Product Requirements Template

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Accessing the Space Home Page (https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY) will redirect you to last visited between "Overview" and "Pages" space links.
In other words, Confluence buffers the link and uses it as the Space Home Page when you access the space again.

h3. Environment

Confluence new Experience


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access the Space Home page: https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/overview
# Open a new tab and enter the URL as follows: https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY
# Press enter. This should send you to the Overview page.
# Now, on the left panel, click on the "Pages" icon.
# Again, on new tab, enter the URL: https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY


h3. Expected Results

You're redirected to the original Home Page: (https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/overview)

h3. Actual Results

You land on the "Pages" URL: (https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages)
fields.summary: Confluence inconsistently resolves the space home page URL.

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Anonymous user able to view contributor icon after the new confluence layout is introduced.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Configure Allow anonymous access on confluence global permission
# Create a space called *Test* and configure anonymous access on space permission.
# Create  2 pages
# Access *test* space from a different browser (Don't log in)
# Click > pages on the left

h3. Observed Behaviour
 !Screen Shot 2017-08-25 at 9.26.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Behaviour

Anonymous user should not see contributor icon (profile picture)
fields.summary: Anonymous user able to view contributor icon

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence new look, the configured footer with Page Properties report macro in the space's look and feel doesn't render the results on all pages.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-9b409b5
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Add a Page Properties macro to a page like a table below and add 'test' label to the page
|Version|2|
|Document|File|
|Type|PDF|

2. Configure the space footer to have a Page Properties Report Macro
{code:java}
detailssummary:cql=label=test|spaces=@all|headings=Version, Document, Type|sortBy=Document number}{code}
3. Access a page within the space
h3. Expected Results

The Page Properties Report macro should be displayed in the footer of all pages
h3. Actual Results

An error message is showing in the footer of all pages
{code:java}
The page properties report macro must be used within a space.{code}
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Page Properties report macro added to Space Footer is not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Related labels* macro generated links are not working properly and all ends with *$label.getUrlPath($spaceKey)*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a *Related labels* macro on your page and choose a label that will populate the macro.
# Publish the page.
# Click on any link generated by the *Related labels* macro.

h3. Expected Results
You are properly redirected when clicking on a link.

h3. Actual Results
You are redirected to an error page _Oops, you've found a dead link_
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Related labels macro generates broken links

fields.description:
Problem Definition
In New Look Confluence, the default space homepage (overview page) does not allow a Page footer.

Suggested Solution
Allow page footer (or possibility to enable/disable if not wanted)
fields.summary: Space overview home page does not alow page footer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, spaces list macro only shows space name, and browse, favorite, add page, but users would like to be able to display further columns with more information. For example, space administrator, creator, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow option in spaces list macro to include more columns.

h3. Why this is important
helps get a better overview on all the spaces and who controls them.
 
h3. Workaround 
Space Details macro does include administrator and created by, but it doesn't work on a larger scale when wanting a whole overview.
fields.summary: Allow user to select additional columns to display in Space List Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the *Link to this page* option will not show up the pop-up displaying the full and tiny link to the page but instead will open the page information instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the *Link to this page* option in the page operations menu.

h3. Expected Results
A pop-up displaying the full and tiny link for the page appears.

h3. Actual Results
User is redirected to the page information.
 
h3.Workaround
You can get the tiny link from the page information.
fields.summary: Link to this page option redirects to the page information instead

fields.description: If end user wants to have any access permission to space and page under the space, end user wants to know contact person for the target space. Therefore, it would be better to have Confluence lead info like JIRA project lead and display it on space overview page.
fields.summary: To have Confluence lead info like JIRA Project lead

fields.description:
With the introduction of [Confluence's new look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], the number of options to change colours in Confluence has been reduced to only two (fonts and sidebar):

!sidebar.png|thumbnail!

In the previous Confluence look, multiple options were provided in order to change different details for the colour scheme:

!previous.png|thumbnail!

This is a suggestion to allow the new Confluence look to have the same (or more) number of customizations to be applied in terms of colours.
fields.summary: Additional Options for Colour in Confluence's New Look

fields.description:
While using Team Calendars, the user is able to work with [reminders|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/reminders-693899708.html] so it will send an email to the user about the event. 

This is a suggestion to allow Team Calendars to create a ticket in JIRA with the current event/reminder subject and have it assigned to the responsible for the event.
fields.summary: Option to Create JIRA Tickets as Reminders in Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Unable to open the video in Confluence

h3. How to Replicate
 # Create a Confluence page.
 # Attach a video file to the page (e.g: mp4)
 # Publish the page. !Browser console log.png!
 # Open the video

h3. Instance Details
 * Unicorn, Cloud Environment
 Confluence 1000.1860.0

h3. Actual Result

Showing from the screen:
 Ouch! We can't load the media file.

[https://media-api.atlassian.io/file/0179d0a0-bc9a-492f-b8ce-1d79b18a2a9f/artifact/video_640.mp4/binary?client=baf9a9f0-e6f8-4b0f-9cc8-0f65bdbdc52b&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJiYWY5YTlmMC1lNmY4LTRiMGYtOWNjOC0wZjY1YmRiZGM1MmIiLCJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpmaWxlOjAxNzlkMGEwLWJjOWEtNDkyZi1iOGNlLTFkNzliMThhMmE5ZiI6WyJyZWFkIl19LCJleHAiOjE1MDM1NjczNTYsIm5iZiI6MTUwMzU2Mzk5Nn0.sCU8G0d5x-wbU90QaD32Va_ML8Vsga7vK1p_R0UJvqQ]



!Error in preview panel.png!

From browser console log

 VIDEOJS: ERROR: (CODE:4 MEDIA_ERR_SRC_NOT_SUPPORTED) The media could not be loaded, either because the server or network failed or because the format is not supported. l \{code: 4, message: "The media could not be loaded, either because the …rk failed or because the format is not supported."}



!Error in UI panel.png!  

Workaround

Download the video file first.
fields.summary: Unable to open video in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page tree is missing from the space sidebar on certain pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a page that is not the space homepage.

h3. Expected Results
The page tree is displayed in the space sidebar.

h3. Actual Results
The page tree is not displayed in the space sidebar.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Page tree is missing from the space sidebar on some pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Error message is displayed at the top of the Agile Wallboard Gadget:
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that a board exists in your instance
# Add a "Agile Wallboard Gadget" to any page in confluence and reference any board with any settings


h3. Expected Results
The board is displayed without any error

h3. Actual Results
The Board is displayed, but also shows the error at the top.
Checking the Javascript console shows errors like:
- Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: e.get(...).done is not a function
- POST https://INSTANCENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest 500 ()

Checking Network communications shows 500 errors to "/wiki/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest"
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There are no workarounds, however this does not appear to functionally impact the use of the gadget. The Gadget can continue to be used normally beyond the addition of the error.
fields.summary: Error message at top of Agile Wallboard Gadget

fields.description:
h3.Summary
The All Spaces located on the Sidebar for Anonymous Users when entering the site does not have a consistent sorting. After performing a few tests, we could see some interesting points which will be referred to below. An interesting approach would be to display the spaces either in Newest to Oldest, or Alphabetically for the sake of user experience while looking onto it. 

h3.Steps to Create the All Spaces Dashboard
This Dashboard appears only for Anonymous Users that are not logged onto the instance, thus to make them appear the steps below are required:
# Create a Space
# In *Space Permissions*, allow *View* permission for Anonymous Users
# Access the Site as an Anonymous user.

For the sake of the explanation, I've created four spaces listed below:
- *A Space* by the Space Key *ASP*
- *B Space* by the Space Key *BSP*
- *C Space* by the Space Key *CSP*
- *D Space* by the Space Key *DSP*

h5.Permissions Added, now what?
After setting the permission onto the space, when acessing the Site as an Anonymous user here is the result on the Sidebar:
 !allspaces.png|thumbnail! 

The Spaces as seen below are sorted alphabetically. Now, let's edit the *D Space* (the last one in the list), and we can actually see, that the list is sorted by Modification Date as you can see from the screenshot below after modifying a page on the space:
 !moddate.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Behavior
If the sorting is made by modification date, the spaces should remain as they are, with the latest edited space first, and so on. But, if you refresh the page, you can see that the *D Space* that was modified last, actually returns to the end of the list, as the screenshot below:
 !endoflist.png|thumbnail! 

The behavior is consistent and can be replicated by following the steps described above.

h3.The Request
It would be nice to have a way to set how the list will be sorted, or even a documentation on the behavior of the functionality. Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to configure the Sorting of the All Spaces Dashboard in the Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you're viewing a page and another user makes a change on this page, like adding a comment to the page, a little pop-up modal appears on the top right corner of the page informing the user that another user has made a change on this page, and in this modal there's a "_Reload_" link for the user to reload the page to see change, however when this reload link is clicked the page simply refreshes itself but there's no indication of what was the change the other user made, so it's hard to know for sure what the change was.
Say there are many users commenting on the page at the same time, how can we tell what is the change each user made that triggered the pop-up modal to appear?
h3. Suggested Solution
When the page refreshes it should go straight to the point of the change, say scroll to the comment that was added and also highlight it for the user to be sure what was the change that was made.
h3. Why this is important
So we can keep track of the changes and most importantly the order of the changes, since the other of the changes are key to keep things in context.
fields.summary: The pop-up modal for updates in the page should highlight the change made
Site export finishes but no link is provided

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the space is configured to allow space exports to anonymous users, these anonymous users can't access this area of the space tools to be able to export the space because the space tools isn't available for anonymous users in the new look.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with the new look.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a space admin, go to the space permissions and allow anonymous users to export the space
# Access the space as an anonymous user

h3. Expected Results
As an anonymous user you would be able to access the Space Tools menu to go to its Export section to export the space.

h3. Actual Results
The Space Tools menu isn't available.
 

h3.Workaround
As an anonymous user you can still access the area to export the space by going to its URL directly:
- https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/exportspacewelcome.action?key=<SPACE-KEY>
fields.summary: Anonymous users can't access space tools on Confluence's new look

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Confluence Search with a CQL that will use a Parent page with a large number of child pages that will retrieve a lot of information (page content), it will result in the following message:

{quote}*Oops, something went wrong with your search.*
We could not successfully complete the search. CQL was parsed but searchManager was unable to execute searchContent. CQL: parent = "xxxx" was parsed to searchContent query due to :message was removed because it mays contain customer sensitive information
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a parent page
# Be sure to have a large number of child pages (e.g. 254)
# Try to run a Confluence Search with the filter *With Parent* for the specific parent page

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should return a list of child pages, like the following example:
!cql2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
The following message is displayed:
!cql.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
Macros that rely on the Confluence Search will be also affected in this case. For example, the *Content by Label* macro, if using the *With Parent* filter.

h3.Workaround
Move/reduce the number of child pages until the search properly works.
fields.summary: [Backend] Specific CQL (Confluence Query Language) Results in "message was removed because it mays contain customer sensitive information"

fields.description:
As a Confluence User, I want to be able to configure the Projects macro to suit the needs of my document so that I can convey appropriate information to respective audiences.

Right now, the Projects macro has limited configurability, only displaying Open issues by Priority in a detail view. It would be desirable to be able to choose what information to display in this macro, at least at an issue level, but be able to choose what Project Details to include as well. For example, the ability to view _all_ issues by _status_ instead of just _open_ issues by _priority_, or at least be able to choose what issues to display (possibly via a Saved filter like other macros). Additionally, being able to select additional project details like the Project Category, Project Type, etc. would be useful.
fields.summary: Ability to Configure Projects Macro

fields.description: In the new look Confluence, when I click on the top level in the breadcrumbs, it directs me to the page tree. Previously, it directed to the home page.  From what I can find on other websites with location-based breadcrumbs, it's fairly standard practice for the top level to go to the home page, so I believe this is what most users will expect. Being directed to a page tree instead is confusing, makes it hard to find the home page again, and diminishes the value of the home page as an aid to navigation.
fields.summary: Direct top level breadcrumb to home page instead of page tree

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who have the New Confluence Look are experiencing issues with viewing the Scroll bar on the Confluence Admin Sidebar

The Scroll Bar appears to be a slightly darker shade of Blue as the Sidebar itself:
!ConfluenceAdminSidebar.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the Color so that it is more visible
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Increase the Visibility of the Scroll Bar within the Confluence Administrator Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have more than one task to check/uncheck in the same page it may be reasonable for you to click all of them very fast, one after the other. And when we do this fast check/uncheck of tasks in the page it will throw an error at some point and the task won't be checked/uncheked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add some tasks to a page and save the page
# Start checking them one by one very fast

h3. Expected Results

The checks/unchecks are saved.
h3. Actual Results

At some point this will throw an error on top of the page:

{quote}Oops! Your task change couldn't be saved. 
 There could be a few reasons for this. Dismiss{quote}

Checking the browser's console you'll see a 500 error on the POST saying something like

{quote}Inline Task #3 was not persisted to CHECKED because of  (status: error){quote}
h3. Notes

This can be reproducible on both old and new look. See screenshots for the errors
 !Screen Shot 2017-08-22 at 15.18.08.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-08-22 at 15.21.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Checking/unchecking tasks very fast on a page gives error

fields.description: Create a keyboard shortcut that enables users to change the text colour on the Editor without needing a mouse.
fields.summary: Create a Shortcut for Colour Change on the Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you want to restrict a page and search a user using IE 11, it will not return any result.

h3. Environment
IE 11
Confluence 1000.0.0-6b95b80

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Chose the Restrictions icon at the top of the page.
# Choose whether you just want to limit only who can Edit, or who can View and / or Edit.
# Enter a user to add them to the list

h3. Expected Results
* Should be able to search user to add them to the Page Restriction list

h3. Actual Results
* Unable to search user to add them to the Page Restriction list

h3.Workaround
Use other browser like Chrome or Firefox
fields.summary: Searching users when restricting a page is not working in IE 11

fields.description:
Summary
Create Page Button Disappeared on the page menu.

Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to the Pages Page.

Expected Result
* Create Button appear.

Actual Result
* Create Button is disappeared

Workaround
Create the page using the "+" on the sidebar.
fields.summary: Create Page Button Disappeared on the page menu.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In New Look Confluence, the default space homepage (overview page) does not allow for comments. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow comments on the homepage (or possibility to enable/disable if not wanted)
fields.summary: Space overview home page does not allow comments

fields.description:
Summary
Macro Attachments doesn't work correctly

Steps to reproduce
# Create the page
# Attach the images on the page.
# Insert Attachment Macro
# Edit Attachment Macro > Preview > Save
# Publish

Expected Result
* Showing on the page same appearance as the preview (display the image preview).

Actual Result
* Not showing on the page the image preview on attachment macro

Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Macro Attachments doesn't show image preview

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pages are not loading in Confluence Cloud with the new layout. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse any page that is not the space/site homepage.

h3. Expected Results
The page is displayed properly.

h3. Actual Results
The page stays blank and the following error are seeing in the console:
{noformat}
Cannot read property 'content' of undefined
Cannot read property 'spaces' of undefined
Cannot read property 'webItemSections' of undefined
Cannot read property 'webPanels' of undefined
Cannot read property 'spaViewModel' of undefined
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
None.

h3. Notes
Issue has been fixed so pages should be browsable again.
fields.summary: Pages are not loading in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page reorder does not work properly when there are a lot of pages in space.
In fact page reorder stops working properly when _scrollbar_ appears on this reorder page.

h3. Environment
*1000.1859.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a space that has 15-20 pages
# Go to <Space_name> -> _Space Tools_ -> _Content Tools_ -> _Reorder pages_
# Make sure you have enough pages so that scrollbar appears on the right side (you can achieve it by expanding all pages/sub-pages, minimizing your browser page)
# Try to reorder page

h3. Expected Results

Page should be properly reordered, according to where you are moving it.

h3. Actual Results

Underline is not following the dragged page while reordering.
Page will be moved to a random spot, or will not be moved at all.

h3. Note
This only happens where the double scrollbars are showing.

h3.Workaround

Make sure you do not have scrollbar on the right side when reordering pages. It can be achieved by collapsing all possible pages and maximizing browser.
fields.summary: Page reorder does not work for new look and feel when there are a lot of pages in space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot search for an user with multi-byte characters in full name at Share this page.

User is not able to add in Share this page dialog.
# User Full name is multi-byte characters.
# User has created a page or a space.

h3. Expected Results
Multi-byte full name user will be added to Share this page dialog.

h3. Actual Results
Multi-byte full name user will not be added to Share this page dialog.
The multi-byte full name user cannot be searchable in Share this page dialog.
 !cannot_found_user.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use the username(non-multi byte) instead.
fields.summary: Cannot search for an user with multi-byte characters in full name at Share this page
Pages with InlineTasks without ID in cause Space Import to Fail

fields.description:
With the introduction of [Confluence's New Look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], when a page is updated, it will display a picture of the user.

For some users, it might be useful to be able to either hide the picture of who edited it or remove the updated information from the page header (maybe hovering the cursor could display it?).
fields.summary: Option to Hide Last Updated in Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using another page as the Homepage for a Space will break the page tree on the sidebar

h3. Environment
Confluence New Look and Feel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Space on Confluence
# Create a new Page (A) on that space
# Set this page as the homepage for this space
# Move all child pages from the old homepage (B) to the new one (A)
# Delete the old homepage (B)
# Click on 'Pages' navigate to any child page

h3. Expected Behavior
The sidebar should load the space's page tree.

h3. Actual Behavior
The sidebar doesn't load the page tree.

h3. Workaround
Navigate through the Space by using 'Pages'
fields.summary: Using another page as the Homepage for a Space will break the page tree on the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the introduction of Confluence's new look, it adds a margin space to the left-hand side of the page when making use of the specific macro to display content. This also includes adding Livesearch macro on the page, where the content font format changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page in Confluence (in this case, we have used a page with the *Meeting Notes* template)
 # Insert a bit of text and headings, so the user can get a better picture of the issue.
 # Insert the *Page Tree Macro* from *Macros > Insert*
 # Save

h3. Expected Results

The page should be rendered with the same format
h3. Actual Results

The content is pushed to the right side/center of the page
h3. Notes

Attached screenshots for prior to adding the macros, after and the editor.
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Formatting Changes when Including Specific Macros in Pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With Confluence new layout, many customisations options were removed such as changing links colour.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Re-introduce more options for *Colour Scheme* with Confluence new layout.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Re-introduce more options to Colour Scheme with Confluence new layout

fields.description:
In the previous application's architecture, the user was able to "right click > Create" in order to create a new page in another tab. With the introduction of [Confluence's new look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], this function does work anymore. 

This is a suggestion to allow the user to create a new page through a new tab with the new look of Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to Create Pages in a New Tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Filter Result gadget missing a few fields and custome field also.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Add filter result gadget in Confluence page
# Click edit 



h3. Observed Behaviour
 !Observed.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Behaviour

User should be able to see the following field also:
* Columns
* Summary
* Epic link
* Customer Name
* Status
* Jira custom field

h3. Workaround

Use Jira issue Macro
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html
fields.summary: Filter Result Gadget missing a few fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are Javascript errors in Browser console when editing a macro.
h3. Environment
h3. Confluence 1000.1846.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and add any macro (e.g Status Macro)
 # Open Browser's Developer Tools > Console Tab
 # Edit the page, edit the Status Macro added on Step 1
 # Browser Console will throw Javascript errors

h3. Expected Results
 * Editing the status macro is working fine, it should not throw any javascript errors on the Browser console.

h3. Actual Results
 * An error is thrown on the Browser's console when editing a macro
{code:java}
batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&build-number=6452&confluence.table.resizable=true&externals=__local-default__&highlightactions=true&isSystemAdministrator=true&locale=en-GB:1943 Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute 'setBaseAndExtent' on 'Selection': There is no child at offset 1.

at DOMUtils.b (https://d1ixbz5qgnvms3.cloudfront.net/test.atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/1377388096/h/3c62bf82c6ec2cf2c16e05369a6ee633/_/download/contextbatch/js/request-access-plugin,editor,macro-browser,-_super,-viewcontent,-main,-atl.general,-page,-browser-metrics-plugin.contrib,-atl.comments/batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&build-number=6452&confluence.table.resizable=true&externals=__local-default__&highlightactions=true&isSystemAdministrator=true&locale=en-GB:2239:155)

{code}
fields.summary: Javascript errors in editor when editing a macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Change restriction link does not work from the share page dialog

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a restriction to a page
# Click on *Share*
# From within the share dialog click on *Change*

h3. Expected Results

The page restriction configuration should appear.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing will happen and an error will be seen on the browser console.

 !restriction link.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3.Workaround

Use the *Three dot menu > Restrictions* on the page to change the restrictions and then share the page.
fields.summary: Change restriction link does not work from the share page dialog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Orphaned Pages tab only shows pages that both (a) have no incoming links, and (b) are not in the page hierarchy. As a result, a page buried in the tree somewhere won't show up even if it has no incoming links.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Show a flat list of all pages in the wiki.
Have three columns:
In page hierarchy (checked or unchecked)
# of incoming links
# of outgoing links
Allow filtering on any of those columns, so I can show, for example, only pages not in the page hierarchy, or only pages with 0 incoming links.
Allow sorting on any of those columns, so I can show the pages with the fewest incoming links (which are thus hard to find) or the pages with the fewest outgoing links (the most dead-end pages).

{quote}
The biggest navigation problems in a wiki are caused by pages that are hard to find, and pages that are dead ends. Changes like I've described above would let me find such pages and improve them, thus improving the overall quality of our wiki.
{quote}
fields.summary: Orphaned Pages tab Improvement

fields.description:
h2. Summary
In the new layout for Confluence, the page tree will not appear if you open a parent page first. The page tree only appears if you click on any child page. Once the page tree is showing, you can then click on any pages.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Navigate to a space
# Click *Pages*
# Click on any parent page
# Page tree will not appear on the side bar

h2. Expected Result
The page tree should appear on the side bar.

h2. Current Result
The page tree is not appearing on the side bar, unless user click on a child page first
fields.summary: Page tree not showing if user opens a parent page first

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, it is not possible to configure the space shortcuts in the new layout for Confluence.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Have a feature to configure/reorder space shortcuts on the side bar.
fields.summary: Ability to configure space shortcuts in the new layout of Confluence

fields.description:
When opening an existing page, certain benign operations mark the editor as having unpublished changes. Of note, this will also cause the diff shown in the "View changes" menu item to be empty (no blue/green/red highlighted text)

Steps to reproduce
 # Edit an existing page
 # Focus the editor and do one of the things from the list below
 # Click "Close"

Expected:
 * No unpublished changes lozenge on View Page

Actual:
 * Unpublished changes lozenge on View Page

Known list of editor actions that trigger unpublished changes:
 * Navigate cursor via keyboard arrow keys
 * Page up/down, home
 * Escape
 * Select All
 * Select text and press Copy (command+C)
 * Open Insert menu, link dialog, or attachments dialog
 * Preview

*Note*
The unpublished changes lozenge only shows to people that have entered the editor and made changes (spurious ones outlined in this ticket or real changes). Other historical contributors to the page or just page viewers will _not_ see the lozenge. If the lozenge is really bothering you, proceed to the workaround below.

*Workaround*
 * Under the ellipsis menu, click "Revert unpublished changes". _Make sure you don't accidentally revert changes you do want to keep_ by clicking _View Changes_.
fields.summary: Certain editor operations result in spurious "unpublished changes" and an empty diff

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After the new look for Confluence "Ctrl + F" does not work as a forward-char key shortcut in comment or page edit on macOS.
It works as same as "Command + F". it is search key shortcut.
Before the new look  "Ctrl + F" works as a forward-char key shortcut.

h3. Environment
* macOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence with macOS Chrome/Firefox
# Input text in comment area
# Press Control + F in the comment area

h3. Expected Results
Control + F works as a forward-char key shortcut.
Command + F works as a search key shortcut.

h3. Actual Results
Control + F works as a search key shortcut.
Command + F works as a search key shortcut.
Also I press Control + F, I can see the error message in browser's console.

{code:title=Chrome}
atlassian-editor-plugins.d3223e92645048d1e7e7-v16.js:formatted:9730 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'preventDefault' of undefined
    at g.o (atlassian-editor-plugins.d3223e92645048d1e7e7-v16.js:formatted:9730)
    at t.o [as fire] (atlassian-editor.min.js:9)
    at g.fire (atlassian-editor.min.js:9)
    at p.c (atlassian-editor.min.js:11)
    at e (atlassian-editor.min.js:1)
    at HTMLBodyElement.g (atlassian-editor.min.js:1)
{code}

{code:title=Firefox}
TypeError: t is undefined[Learn More]  atlassian-editor-plugins.d3223e92645048d1e7e7-v16.js:11:170472
	o https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins.d3223e92645048d1e7e7-v16.js:11:170472
	o https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.5011091658b03eaa60b2-v16.js:1:275745
	fire https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.5011091658b03eaa60b2-v16.js:1:277311
	c https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.5011091658b03eaa60b2-v16.js:1:327427
	e https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.5011091658b03eaa60b2-v16.js:1:9490
	g https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.5011091658b03eaa60b2-v16.js:1:9832

fields.description:
*Summary*

Users having difficulty to choose Jira projects when they importing confluence space if they have more than 40 Projects in Jira.
fields.summary: Sort Project name in Link to cloud project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, user email is not visible for the Confluence administrator although the *User Email visibility* is set to be visible for *site-administrators* only.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud version {{1000.1846.0}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Security Configuration* in Confluence.
 # Set *User Email Visibility* to *only visible to site administrators*.
 # Log in as a Confluence administrator.
 # In Confluence, click on a user's profile.

h3. Expected Results

User's email to be visible only to Confluence administrators. See Confluence [User Email Visibility|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/user-email-visibility-724765573.html].
h3. Actual Results

User email is not visible to the Confluence administrator.
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Email is not visible for Confluence administrators  although Email visibility is set to site admin

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Add one more step on documentation link to add label by clicking the "clip" icon on the page

Souce documentation link
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-remove-and-search-for-labels-724764874.html
fields.summary: Add one more step on documentation link to add label by clicking the "clip" icon on the page
NPE Removing Drafts When Importing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When collapsing the sidebar, the correspondent breadcrumb to the Home page of the space will be displayed. However, when clicking on that, the user will be redirected to the *Pages* part of the space, instead of the Home page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to a space with pages already created
# Access one of the pages
# Click on the sidebar in order to have it collapsed, so the link for the home will be displayed
# Notice that it will redirect the user to *Pages* instead of the Home page.

h3. Expected Results

Be redirected to the Home page.

h3. Actual Results
The user is being redirected to *Pages*
 
h3. Notes



h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Top Level Breadcrumbs Directs to Pages instead of Home

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have an add-on that inserts options next to the page buttons and/or within the ellipsis menu *AND* you have a page with a name large enough, the page buttons and the padlock are overlapped by the page name.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with the new look

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install an add-on that add options next to the page buttons (it can be the Source Page Editor, or the Copy Page Tree)
# Create a page with a significant large name and save it

h3. Expected Results

When viewing the page the buttons should be there

h3. Actual Results
The page name overlaps the buttons
 
h3. Notes
See screenshots for before and after

h3.Workaround
Disable the add-on that adds such options.
fields.summary: Page buttons and padlock are overlapped by page name

fields.description:
In Confluence, the nearest add-on that we have in terms of location is the [Google Maps for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/atlassian-connect-gmaps/cloud/overview], which is from Atlassian Labs.

 

This is a suggestion to have a bundled macro/add-on for GPS usage in the instance. For example, when enabling it, the same will recognize exactly where the user is and provide the information for that area.
fields.summary: GPS Macro for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence backup fails due to the amount of attachments

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence backup manager
# Start a backup with attachments

h3. Expected Results
Backup is created successfully

h3. Actual Results
Confluence goes out of memory and backup fails.

h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
# Go to Confluence backup manager
# Start a backup without attachments
# Create an issue at getsupport.atlassian.com and ask for attachments backup
fields.summary: Confluence backup fails due to the amount of attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The options within the "Your profile and user settings" menu on the global sidebar is implemented as an image with no alt. Screen reader users will hear this content identified only by the image's src value.

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud with the new look


h3.Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Options within "Your profile and user settings" are not screen reader friendly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All main items in the global sidebar below the Confluence Home, like the Search, Create, Notification, Switch apps and Profile, aren't tabbable. Only the Confluence Home is.

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud with the new look

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Place the cursor on the browser URL field
# Press tab to go to the Confluence home button
# Press tab again

h3. Expected Results

You should be taken to the Search button

h3. Actual Results

It skips all menus and go to the logo

h3.Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Menus below Confluence Home are not tabbale

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a space homepage is set as Confluence site homepage, the global sidebar will be displayed upon accessing Confluence instead of the space sidebar.
Therefore, space shortcuts will not be displayed upon landing on Confluence unless you go to the actual space or remove the _?mode=global_ text appended to the URL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a space homepage as your site homepage
# Access Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar used is the space sidebar showing the custom shortcuts for users so they can access their documentation easily.

h3. Actual Results
The global sidebar is shown instead and users have to make some extra actions in order to see the space sidebar displayed.
 
h3.Workaround
Manually remove the *?mode=global* appended to the URL in order to have the space sidebar displayed.
fields.summary: Global sidebar instead of the space sidebar is displayed if a space homepage is set as Confluence site homepage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Currently downloading and uploading files inside companion does not attempt to use proxy settings on the user's computer.  This causes uploading and downloading to fail.  It also causes JWT validation to fail so the to the user it never looks like Companion connected to anything.

h3. Workaround
 * Use the down/up arrow icons on the top of the page to download the document, edit and upload back to Confluence.
fields.summary: Atlassian companion should respect OS level proxy settings

fields.description:
Users are looking for a computer - to - computer mechanism to get notifications - which is provided for by web hooks.

By way of example - if you look at status.bitbucket.org, you'll see an <> icon - which represents web hooks. (Screenshot attached) This allows me to specify an HTTP endpoint that statuspage will send a request to should a component on your side fail.

This is the ability that users are looking for, and which is not present for status.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Specific Webhook EndPoint for Jira and Confluence Cloud on status.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user select *Show More* on the *Recently updated macro*, nothing is displayed instead of the actual results. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-e7aca8b

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 confluence pages on a space
# Create another confluence page on the same space and insert a *Recently Updated Macro*
 ** Macro settings: / Space(s) *your space key* / Maximum Number of Pages *2*
# On the *Recently Updated Macro* results > Select *Show more*.
# Nothing will display

h3. Expected Results
The 'Show More' should display more macro results.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed when you click on 'Show More'
fields.summary: Show More results of Recently Updated macro not working

fields.description:
the new look and feel hides  company logo from the top of the page. Logo is only on the side panel when it pops out.

Also the Atlassian logo is there now when side-panel is pops back.
fields.summary: New look and feel hides company logo from the top of the page

fields.description:
With the [introduction of Confluence's new look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], the *Blog* option on the sidebar will open a list with the posts from the current year:

 

!after.png|thumbnail!

 

In the older version, the user was able to have it separated by months and years, for example:

 

!before.png|thumbnail!

 

This is a suggestion to allow the new Confluence look to have the blogs separated by date, as it was before, but, in the new sidebar.
fields.summary: Option to Separate Blog Posts by Date

fields.description:
To reproduce:
 # Used POST to create a Space property, get 200 response with the space property and it's ID
 # Used GET /space/foo/property to fetch all space properties, got an empty list
 # Used GET /space/foo/property/bar to fetch the created space property, got 404
fields.summary: Creating Space Property with REST Returns 200 But Not Created

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who had opt-out from New Confluence Look and Feel have the 'Confluence' button redirecting to a non-existing page due to an extra 'all-updates' on the URL

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.1832.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Opt-out from Confluence New Look and Feel
# Click on the 'Confluence' logo on the top bar

h3. Expected Results
You should land on Confluence's home page through a link like below:

https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates

h3. Actual Results
You land on a 'Page Not Found', with the following link:

https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates/all-updates

h3. Workaround
* Opt back in to the New Confluence Experience (Click *Profile* -> *Experience the New Confluence*)
* Manually navigate to the right link by removing the '/all-updates' at the end of the URL.
fields.summary: Customers who had opt-out from New Confluence Look and Feel have the 'Confluence' button redirecting to a non-existing page due to an extra 'all-updates' on the URL

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of June 4, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi team,

We’re super excited to announce that we’ve just finished rolling out this change for ALL Confluence Cloud customers. Please check it out and help us spread the word to your team.

In addition to the page tree in the sidebar, we’re also working on some other navigation improvements and would love to partner with you to make sure they’re meeting your needs. If you're interested, please contact us at [confluence-beta@atlassian.com|mailto:confluence-beta@atlassian.com] to join our beta program as early adopters.

 

Warm regards,

Elaine and the Confluence team
{panel}
----
h3. Problem Definition

Recently, [New navigation and a new look for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html] is introduced. The page tree no longer showing on the sidebar.

Unless, we go to *Pages*, then access a page.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please shows the Page Tree sidebar on Space view.
h3. Why this is important
 * To reduce the time and effort
 ** If we leave the space, we will lose the page tree and then have to go through several clicks to get back to it - which we didn't have to do before.

----
{panel:title=Original Request}
In the new look of Confluence, the sidebar will only display the page tree for pages within the Space OR you can select pages and a list of pages is displayed.  This is very unfriendly and inconsistent when navigating to the main Space pages.  My users all depend on that sidebar page tree list when navigating to a Space Page.   

I am busy adding in a "\{children}" macro to all Space pages.

Please provide an option to have the Page Tree on the sidebar for the Space main Page.
{panel}
fields.summary: Require Option to have Pages expanded on the Sidebar for the Space view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JUnit Report macro in Confluence fails to render if the XML used contains a failure message tag.

{code}
  <testcase classname="JUnitXmlReporter.constructor" name="should default path to an empty string" time="0.006">
	 <failure message="test failure">Assertion failed</failure>
  </testcase>
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use  [^testfailed.xml] on a JUnit Report Macro

h3. Expected Results

The report should render properly on the page.

h3. Actual Results

The macro does not load on the page.
fields.summary: JUnit macro does not load if there is a failure message tag in the XML

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Have the option to remove export page permission.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Navigate to a page in Confluence.
 # Open the ellipsis(...) menu Export to PDF or Export to Word

h3. Expected Result
 * Have the option to remove export page permission.

h3. Actual Result
 * Don't have the option to remove export page permission.

h3. Workaround
h3. * No workaround
fields.summary: Have option to remove export page permission.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

From JIRA Service Desk KB perspective, there are cases where a single page is generic across multiple KB spaces. It is not possible at the moment to maintain a single page which can be made available across multiple spaces. The include macro can share a page on another space but the end user has to have access to the source space where the single page is maintained.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to share page across multiple spaces even if the end user has no access to the source space.

h3. Why this is important

The feature can eliminate the need for KB administrators to maintain multiple copies of a single page across KB spaces.
fields.summary: Maintain a single page across multiple spaces
test
Like button in inline comment is mis-styled

fields.description:
The Insert Link dialog should support telephone links.

!Screen Shot 2017-08-16 at 3.47.00 PM.png!
fields.summary: Support tel: links

fields.description:
In [Confluence's new look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], when a page is updated, it will bring the information on who modified, when it was modified and a picture of the user at the top of the page.

This is a suggestion to provide a bundled option to change the location of the information to the bottom, for example.
fields.summary: Option to Change the "Last Modified" Location

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JUnit report macro fails if there are multiple testsuites in XML file wrapped by a <testsuites></testsuites> tag.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup the JUnit macro:
# Download the attached [^ReportInJUnitFormat.xml]
# Link the macro to the file

h3. Expected Results

Multiple tests are rendered

h3. Actual Results

No results will be displayed
 !empty.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Remove the <testsuites></testsuites> tags and create separate XML files containing one <testsuite></testsuite> each. These XML files can then be used on separate JUnit Macros on the page.
fields.summary: JUnit report macro fails if there are multiple testsuites in XML file

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have a header and/or footer configured in the space's look and feel setting this footer will show on all pages of the space, however when certain page you're seeing doesn't have the same macro that's configured in the header/footer also in the body of the page, the macro in the header/footer isn't rendered and doesn't work as it should.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud with the new look and navigation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Configure the space header and/or footer to have an expand macro 
{code:java}
{expand}{expand}{code}
2. Access a page that doesn't have an expand macro in the body
h3. Expected Results

The expand macro in the footer should be collapsed by default and clickable to be expanded.
h3. Actual Results

The content within the expand macro is shown even though the macro looks collapsed, but it's also not clickable to be expanded.
h3. Notes

If another page has an expand macro in the body, the expand macro in the footer works.

This apparently breaks functionality of any macros in the header/footer unless the same macro is displayed in the body of the page.
fields.summary: Macros in the header or footer aren't rendered unless there's an equivalent macro in the body of the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When embedding a team calendar to a page, the *Add event* button is unusable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Embed a calendar to a page with the *Team Calendar* macro.
# Click on the *Add event* button to add some events.

h3. Expected Results
A pop-up is displayed allowing you to add events to your calendar.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens after clicking on the *Add event* button.
The following JS error is seen in the browser's console.
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Confluence.TeamCalendars.Dialogs.getEditEventDialog is not a function
    at s (d3i2khpa91nejt.cloudfront.net/manu-conf2.atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b…ge/batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:907)
    at HTMLButtonElement.<anonymous> (d3i2khpa91nejt.cloudfront.net/manu-conf2.atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b…ge/batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:907)
    at HTMLButtonElement.dispatch (jquery-min.js:2)
    at HTMLButtonElement.s (jquery-min.js:2)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Add events from the calendar itself on the *Calendars* page as it is still working there.
fields.summary: Add event button not responding when embedding a Team Calendar to a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The search function is not working properly.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Search the page on the text box.

h3. Expected Result
 * Can search the newly created page.

h3. Actual Result
 * Can't search the newly created page.

h3. Workaround
 * Run the content indexing.
fields.summary: Search function is not working properly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Cloud instances with *Team Calendars* add-on disabled, the editor sometimes failed to load and displays an infinite spinning wheel making the page uneditable.

This can also affect the ability to add/edit comments and inline comments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Cloud instance with Team Calendars disabled, attempt to edit a page.

h3. Expected Results

The editor loads properly and you are able to edit the page with no issues.
h3. Actual Results

The editor does not load and displays an infinite spinning wheel.
h3. Workaround

None.
 A fix has been implemented and released to Cloud instances already.
fields.summary: Page editor not loading when Team Calendar is disabled for some Cloud instances

fields.description:
h2. Summary

In ADG3-enabled Confluence, pages shared with anonymous users has an option / button on top-right labeled "Add to my spaces". This option / button should not be there.

 

!Screen Shot 2017-08-16 at 2.59.32 PM.png|thumbnail!

 
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Share a confluence page with anonymous users
 # Visit page URL and check for option / button in top right corner

 
h2. Confluence Version
h3. Confluence 1000.0.0-d1082ac
fields.summary: button "Add to My Spaces" needs to be removed for anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using JIRA Macros inside Confluence, it's possible to access JIRA in a frame if clicking on the macro, leading to other issues like:
- When we delete issues in the frame pages are deleted too
- When using Gadgets/Jira macro in a larger page, options like *edit* for the issue will be in the bottom of the Jira frame (to correspond with the size of the Confluence page), making the "Edit screen" to not be visible.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.1184.0
Confluence 1000.1829.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new JIRA macro in a Confluence page
# Click on the Confluence macro and it automatically opens JIRA in a frame inside confluence.
# An example would be the pie chart

h3. Expected Results
It's expected to see details of the macro content
h3. Actual Results
Confluence opens a new frame inside the page with JIRA simulteneously
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JIRA inside Confluence through macros

fields.description:
In Confluence, we have different [search methods|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/search-724765412.html] in order to find specific content in the instance. Sometimes, the user might need to have specific pages/content on top of the search, so it would be the first identified page.

This is a suggestion to give Confluence an option to "tag" specific pages in a way that would make it appear on the top while searching for specific keywords.
fields.summary: Option to Keep Specific Pages on Top for Searching

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Attachments macro produces broken links to the page attachments when the space is exported to HTML.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space
 # Create a page in this space
 # Add attachments to this page
 # Edit the page and add the Attachments macro to the body of this page
 # Go to Space Tools > Content Tools and export this space to HTML
 # Download the ZIP file of the space HTML export to your machine
 # Unzip this file and open the html file corresponding to the page containing the Attachments macro
 # This page will display the files attached to the page in the Attachments macro, so click the name of the file to download this file

h3. Expected Results

The file is downloaded.
h3. Actual Results

An error saying the file couldn't be found.
h3. Notes

When you do this on Confluence itself, Confluence converts the link of the file name to the file ID and then download it. However when you export the space to HTML the link of the file in the Attachments macro isn't converted to the file ID, and checking the attachments folder within the ZIP file the filename is the <file ID>.zip instead of <file name>.zip, thus the page can't find this file within the attachments folder.

Check the screenshots below, the first file of the Attachments macro is named mobile_activity_screen.png, but within the attachments folder it is saved with its ID 1082082.png, and the full link of the file is file:///wiki/download/attachments/1082079/mobile_activity_screen.png, however this file doesn't exist in the attachments folder of the space HTML export.
h3. Workaround

When the space is exported to HTML, at the bottom of each page that has attachments there is a section of the page called "_Attachments_", and within this section the filename points to the file ID, so the file can be downloaded from there instead of the Attachments macro.
fields.summary: Attachments macro produces broken links on space HTML exports

fields.description:
h2. 1.0) Brief

The Confluence UI changes quite often we noticed (our URL: [https://apivio.atlassian.net/wiki/)]. While the cloud-based distribution model is great for back-end services as it provides frequent bug fixes and enhancements, it does not work well for UI changes. Humans are creatures of habits! Constantly moving the visual cues around does not improve our productivity but hinders it on a daily basis.

We're not opposed to UI changes, but may we suggest:
 # do it *once* but no more frequent than annually?
 # have the user opt out of using the "latest and greatest" UI, ala Windows "legacy" UI versus the "improved" Aero UI - permit the users to ease-in to the new UI.
fields.summary: Stop updating the cloud-based Confluence UI so frequently

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Before the new Confluence look and feel, the page tree macro could be used to display the space name and the pages beneath it. There is no combination of settings to achieve this now. You can display the page tree starting from the home page of the space or you can display the space name with no child pages.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a page tree macro to a page
 # Publish the page and see that the space name cannot be displayed above the page tree

h3. Expected Results

In the previous Confluence look and feel, the space name appeared above the page tree.
h3. Actual Results

The page hierarchy can be displayed or the space name, but not both
h3. Notes

Please see this use case from the Community: [Page Tree Macro Only Showing Space Name|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Page-Tree-Macro-Only-Showing-Space-Name/qaq-p/621684]
h3. Workaround

Add the space name on the page as text above the page tree macro.
fields.summary: Page tree macro does not display the name of the space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the new Confluence look, when a user select *Find more results* on the Content Report Table macro it's redirected to 'Page Not Found' instead of the actual results. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-c5a9e98
Confluence 1000.1829.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 confluence pages on a space
# Insert the label *atlassian* in each page.
# Create another confluence page on the same space and insert a *Content Report Table  Macro*
 ** Macro settings: Label(s) *atlassian* / Space(s) *your space key* / Maximum Number of Pages *2*
# On the Content Report Table Macro resulsts Select *Find more results*.
# You will be redirected to a 'Page Not Found'

h3. Expected Results
The find more results should display more macro results.

h3. Actual Results
The find more results is redirected to a 'Page Not Found' 

h3.Workaround
- Right click on the 'Find more results' link and open it in a new tab
fields.summary: Find more results of Content Report Table macro not working in new Confluence look
